commit_message:
HNAS: Deprecating XML config file

Currently HNAS drivers use an external XML configuration file.
This patch will deprecate this file and get all the configurations
from cinder.conf.

Co-Authored-By: Alyson Rosa <alyson.rodrigues.rosa@gmail.com>

DocImpact
Depends-On: I1b5d5155306c39c528af4037a5f54cf3d4dc1ffa
Change-Id: I00f4ae5ccd99f8f5da12e687ef0dc9cdb1717b3b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/76/294076/40 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: HNAS_NFS_VERSION = '5.1.0' cfg.StrOpt('hds_hnas_nfs_config_file', default='/opt/hds/hnas/cinder_nfs_conf.xml', help='Configuration file for HNAS NFS cinder plugin'), cfg.StrOpt('hnas_nfs_mgmt_ip0', help='Management Port 0 IP address. Should be the IP address ' 'of the "Admin" EVS.'), cfg.StrOpt('hnas_nfs_cmd', default='ssc', help=' Command to communicate to HNAS array. '), cfg.StrOpt('hnas_nfs_username', help='HNAS username'), cfg.StrOpt('hnas_nfs_password', help='HNAS password'), cfg.StrOpt('hnas_nfs_ssh_enabled', default=False, help=' Enables SSH authentication between Block Storage ' 'host and the SMU. '), cfg.StrOpt('hnas_nfs_ssh_port', help='Port to be used to SSH authentication.'), cfg.StrOpt('hnas_nfs_ssh_private_key', help='Path to the SSH private key used to authenticate ' 'in HNAS SMU.'), cfg.StrOpt('hnas_nfs_volume_type', help='NFS volume type'), cfg.StrOpt('hnas_nfs_cluster_admin_ip0', default=None, help='The IP of the HNAS cluster admin.'), cfg.StrOpt('hnas_nfs_svc0_volume_type', help='Service 0 volume type'), cfg.StrOpt('hnas_nfs_svc0_hdp', help='Service 0 HDP'), cfg.StrOpt('hnas_nfs_svc1_volume_type', help='Service 1 volume type'), cfg.StrOpt('hnas_nfs_svc1_hdp', help='Service 1 HDP'), cfg.StrOpt('hnas_nfs_svc2_volume_type', help='Service 2 volume type'), cfg.StrOpt('hnas_nfs_svc2_hdp', help='Service 2 HDP'), cfg.StrOpt('hnas_nfs_svc3_volume_type', help='Service 3 volume type'), cfg.StrOpt('hnas_nfs_svc3_hdp', help='Service 3 HDP')] Version 5.1.0: Deprecated XML config file optional_parameters = ['hnas_cmd', 'ssh_enabled', 'cluster_admin_ip0'] self.config = {} # Trying to get HNAS configuration from cinder.conf self.config = hnas_utils.read_cinder_conf( self.configuration, 'nfs') # If HNAS configuration are not set on cinder.conf, tries to use # the deprecated XML configuration file if not self.config: self.config = hnas_utils.read_xml_config( self.configuration.hds_hnas_nfs_config_file, service_parameters, optional_parameters) LOG.error(_LE("Configured share %(share)s is not present "

commit_message:
Remove troveclient and ironicclient from shade libs

Neither library have the ability to be put into LIBS_FROM_GIT, so
putting them into the project or libs list just results in errors.

Change-Id: Ieecf91bfafc35624f7e172bed46a6df02174fcb8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/18/354718/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'\n'"LIBS_FROM_GIT=os-client-config,keystoneauth,python-novaclient,python-keystoneclient,python-glanceclient,python-cinderclient,python-neutronclient,python-swiftclient,python-heatclient,python-designateclient,python-magnumclient"

commit_message:
Add pip_install meta-dep to solve SNI issues

While pip is not required for this role (it does not install any pip
packages) it does ensure that all the required packages are installed
in order to resolve SNI issues when Ansible executes the get_url task
to fetch the RabbitMQ package.

Change-Id: Ic55811136e01fbb9a400cfb8170fcda4fb3b3867
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server refs/changes/49/354749/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - pip_install

subject: Adds a default reload callback to ProcessManager
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-21 09:03:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/b4a94664d4455ff24929faf30a44cd530ae298c1', 'message': "Adds a custom reload command to ProcessManager

Currently, process reload in ProcessManager is being done with 'HUP'.
Some processes, such as haproxy[1], use a different method for reloading
configuration updates.

This patch addes a custom reload command option to handle such cases, while
keeping 'HUP' as the default method.

[1] See -sf flags: http://www.haproxy.org/download/1.2/doc/haproxy-en.txt

Related-Bug: #1565801

Change-Id: Ia2f67e742778cd99f2211c94782635652d9032c7

commit_message:
Adds a default reload callback to ProcessManager

Currently, process reload in ProcessManager is being done with 'HUP'.
Some processes, such as haproxy[1], use a different method for reloading
configuration updates.

This patch addes a default reload callback option to handle such cases, while
keeping 'HUP' as the default method, in case a default reload callback
was not provided.

[1] See -sf flags: http://www.haproxy.org/download/1.2/doc/haproxy-en.txt

Related-Bug: #1565801

Change-Id: Ia2f67e742778cd99f2211c94782635652d9032c7

commit_message:
Fix keepalived sync groups var name

The upstream keepalived role uses keepalived_sync_groups and OSA
is using keepalived_global_sync_groups, causing a misconfigured
keepalived environment to be deployed.

https://github.com/evrardjp/ansible-keepalived/blob/1.6.0/tasks/main.yml#L103
etc.

Backport of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/353701/

Change-Id: I997c74464390f3c5c71de6e9c170671e275c47fb
(cherry picked from commit 7f3f1aab4e393bcc2c2d8656385f6bd4cd00b62f)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/02/353702/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: keepalived_sync_groups:

commit_message:
Add haproxy_service_enabled boolean

Allow endpoints to be disabled in the haproxy_default_services
dict.

This is needed specifically for https://review.openstack.org/#/c/340175/
which requires that the nova-metadata-api service move to the
compute nodes when the networking-calico neutron plugin is used.

In such an environment, the metadata nodes serve requests only for
the local hypervisor and LB endpoints for the metadata service
are not needed.

The corresponding flag disabling haproxy_service_enabled will be
added to the Calico change.

Change-Id: I584fe2647ba0d6a70908e55168360752a08261c5

commit_message:
[WIP] Remove Tempest git source

Tmpest is now published via pypi and is present in
global-requirements and upper-constraints. There is
therefore no reason to maintain the git SHA to
ensure that tests are executed with the same package
versions every time for each of our tags.

This patch removes the git source as it is no longer
needed.

Change-Id: Ie08d0a14cf6e391cf93f3c67d657976517a795e8

commit_message:
[WIP] Implement complete SSL connectivity for RabbitMQ

TODO:
 - Distribute user provided CA certs if configured
 - Ensure that the CA cert is configured to be used
 - Implement group_vars to dynamically set the right
   vars (insecure if no user provided certs, etc)
 - Ensure that RabbitMQ properly verifies certs
 - Release note

Change-Id: I2a9f9a78291fcaf8f20a5c5c0f28e4e90fffa66b

revisions:

commit_message:
[WIP] Gate: Enable 'Depends-On' cross-repo dependent patching for roles

When 'Depends-On: <change-id>' is used in a patch, Zuul cloner must be used
in order to ensure that both patches are actually used for the gate test.

This patch implements the use of zuul-cloner [1] for gate tests.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/infra/zuul/cloner.html

Change-Id: I11d0e310ab4264069529699fe96d640f400c0c8f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/95/286195/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- clonemap: - name: 'openstack/openstack-ansible-(.*)' dest: '/etc/ansible/roles/\1'

commit_message:
Update local_install script for non-tox testing

This patch implements the changes required in order to test
without tox, directly on the host.

Change-Id: I6d94ee12c8df67f45d310d70f86f53cc042c9379
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_ironic refs/changes/60/296060/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016, Rackspace US, Inc.# Ensure the apt cache is updated, and install the packages we need apt-get update apt-get install -y build-essential python2.7 python-dev git-core # Get the latest pip curl --silent --show-error --retry 5 https://bootstrap.pypa.io/get-pip.py | sudo python2.7 # Install Ansible and other requirements for testing pip install -r test-requirements.txt # Tell Ansible where to find libraries and plugins export ANSIBLE_HOME="${HOME}/.ansible" mkdir -p ${ANSIBLE_HOME}export ANSIBLE_ACTION_PLUGINS=${ANSIBLE_HOME}/plugins/action export ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_PLUGINS=${ANSIBLE_HOME}/plugins/callback export ANSIBLE_FILTER_PLUGINS=${ANSIBLE_HOME}/plugins/filter export ANSIBLE_LOOKUP_PLUGINS=${ANSIBLE_HOME}/plugins/lookup export ANSIBLE_LIBRARY=${ANSIBLE_HOME}/plugins/library export ANSIBLE_ROLES_PATH=${ANSIBLE_HOME}/roles:$(pwd)/.. # Fetch the Ansible plugins git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins ${ANSIBLE_HOME}/plugins # Download the required roles ansible-galaxy install --role-file=tests/ansible-role-requirements.yml --ignore-errors --force # Execute a test build ansible-playbook -i tests/inventory tests/test.yml -e rolename="$(basename $(pwd))"
deleted_lines: # Copyright 2015, Rackspace US, Inc.ROLE_NAME=$(basename $(pwd)) # Note(mrda): In testing we often cycle machines, so this just helps our # testing efforts. Don't do this in production. pushd tests ansible-playbook -i inventory local_install.yml -e rolename=${ROLE_NAME} popd

commit_message:
Fix for failure to create vlan-transparent networks with legacy plugins

This fix causes the MechanismManger._check_vlan_transparency method
to fail only if a configured mechanism driver explicitly returns
'False' from its check_vlan_transparency method.

Change-Id: I6303bdf59b30db5d3774e2accb9200774f151474
Closes-Bug: #1611843

commit_message:
Disable creating default network topo in CI

The neutron default network topology includes
a public network and several tenant networks.
These network elements are useless in CI.

Change-Id: I5391d1a898c20b44fb118ee1c20c6946c934573c

commit_message:
Prevent from get_lport in update_port function

We change the internal logic and finally prevent
from the unnecessary get_lport operation from nb-db.

Change-Id: I0f8efb74b40f8ceb4d1b029dad51eddaec8d5423
Closes-Bug: #1611671

commit_message:
Add setting to set OVS manager

Set default manager to listen at 0.0.0.0:6640. This should solve the
fullstack issues.

Closes-Bug: 1599458
Change-Id: I03d5d22cbb47dc0c2c262f8c498cc84a225fbdd5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/72/352072/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OVS_MANAGER=${OVS_MANAGER:-"ptcp:6640:0.0.0.0"}

subject: Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-09 23:48:22.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-libnetwork/commit/c654768ed3e7ce7159c3e48e873723f08b1cfb54', 'message': 'Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: Ifbb4b0bfac3aa146e205726d934d194fea06ff87
'}]
commit_message:
Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: Ifbb4b0bfac3aa146e205726d934d194fea06ff87
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-libnetwork refs/changes/80/353180/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: PYTHONWARNINGS=default::DeprecationWarning

commit_message:
Refactor GPFS driver for NFS ganesha support

Spectrum Scale supports NFS ganesha through CES protocol services. This
change replaces the current NFS ganesha support with the Spectrum Scale
CES infrastructure.

Implements: blueprint gpfs-ces-support

Change-Id: I8eb307c19761788ea71c15c889794f8b5f110253

commit_message:
Add "clean" command to redstack

A long time request has been to add a "redstack clean"
command that would clean out all the trove, nova, cinder
etc resources left around after a failed test run.

This commit adds a "clean" command to redstack. It is a
first cut and hopefully can be evolved by the community
over time.

Change-Id: I5e2e28936161e65e0a4edfa5c4b9d5ffcab6cee8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove-integration refs/changes/88/348088/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function exec_cmd_on_output() { local output_cmd=$1 local exec_cmd=$2 exec $output_cmd|awk -vexec_cmd="$exec_cmd" '{if (NR>3 && $2!="") { cmd = exec_cmd " " $2; print "Executing " cmd; system(cmd) } }' } function cmd_clean() { # reset any stuck backups mysql_trove "update backups set state='COMPLETED'" # clear out any DS version metadata mysql_trove "delete from datastore_version_metadata" # reset any stuck instances, and clear all replicas mysql_trove "update instances set task_id=2, slave_of_id=null" # delete any trove clusters exec_cmd_on_output "trove cluster-list" "trove cluster-delete" # delete any trove instances exec_cmd_on_output "trove list" "trove delete" # delete any backups exec_cmd_on_output "trove backup-list" "trove backup-delete" # delete any configuration groups exec_cmd_on_output "trove configuration-list" "trove configuration-delete" # delete any modules exec_cmd_on_output "trove module-list" "trove module-delete" # sleep for a couple of seconds and then clean up # any remaining nova instances or cinder volumes sleep 2 exec_cmd_on_output "nova list" "nova delete" sleep 2 exec_cmd_on_output "cinder list" "cinder delete" } clean - Clean up resources created by a failed test run. "clean" ) shift; cmd_clean $@;;

commit_message:
Fix resouce group resource removal policy name inconsistency with DB

The resource removal name is broken by change 349402. The resource
removal policy is stored in DB under the name_blacklist attribute.

The attributes are only resolved if the _resolve_attribute is present.

Change-Id: Ic59d0995dac9d324506ef41cf45628023919e2e3
Closes-Bug: #1608409
Signed-off-by: Denes Nemeth <denes.nemeth@nokia.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/97/352297/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: db_rsrc_names = self.data().get('name_blacklist') def _resolve_attribute(self, name): if name == self.REMOVED_RSRC_LIST: return self._current_blacklist()

changing fields in the internal 'mysql' database.

SET PASSWORD and RENAME statements that should work on
all MySQL versions.

We no longer need to transfer privileges on a user name/host
change since the RENAME statement does it for us under the covers.

with MySQL 5.7 which has changed the definition of the

commit_message:
Use proper queries to update user properties

Bug 1380880 occurs when a user gets renamed
and another one gets created wit its original name.

It turns out that the new user wrongly inherits
access rights of the original user.

MySQL guest currently updates user properties by
changing fields in the internal 'mysql' database.

This patch set replaces the UPDATE with more generic
SET PASSWORD and RENAME statements that should work on
all MySQL versions.

We no longer need to transfer privileges on a user name/host
change since the RENAME statement does it for us under the covers.

As an additional benefit this solution is also fully compatible
with MySQL 5.7 which has changed the definition of the
internal 'user' table and the current code no longer works.

Closes-Bug: 1380880
Change-Id: I37fdec77184715ed889d8ea6d446282c98903258

OVSLibTestCase.test_db_find_column_type_list is not isolated
and thus its usage of ovsdb's db_list() and db_find() occasionally

commit_message:
isolate test_db_find_column_type_list

As per the recent gate failures (see bug), it appears
OVSLibTestCase.test_db_find_column_type_list is not isolated
and thus its usage of ovsdb's db_list() and db_find() occasionally
obtain different results.

This patch adds the db_list() and db_find() operations within the
test case to run in a transaction so that we get a single snapshot
of the db results.

In addition this patch undoes the changes from patch set 1 as the
initial changes do not appear to address the issue at hand.

Change-Id: I312076edb6e11f21347831843758894e11d6f56c
Closes-Bug: #1592546

commit_message:
Add ability to change apt/yum package state for the ceph_client role

The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

Change-Id: I80e58182b5c115f2128780a44d549c5b61beb1fc

commit_message:
Include ansible commands for ansible linting

The plugin repo needs to be cloned for ansible-lint to
understand ansible plugins. The commands currently
reside in tox.ini under the ansible section and are not
currently included. This commit fixes that error.

Change-Id: Ib64c9e266469ada11d6534e07ad93ab8906af2eb

subject: Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-12 18:52:27.000000000', 'files': ['bindep.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/api-site/commit/d43e3695665feb9bb81d2de71abaa64b50b47953', 'message': 'Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt

The default filename for documenting binary dependencies has been
changed from "other-requirements.txt" to "bindep.txt" with the release
of bindep 2.1.0. While the previous name is still supported, it will
be deprecated.

Move the file around to follow this change.

Note that this change is self-testing, the OpenStack CI infrastructure
will use a "bindep.txt" file to setup nodes for testing.

For more information about bindep, see also:
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/bindep/

As well as this announcement:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101590.html

Change-Id: I7862a3d3fd962e5658ff15cab3aeb005b0a32bfa
'}]
commit_message:
Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt

The default filename for documenting binary dependencies has been
changed from "other-requirements.txt" to "bindep.txt" with the release
of bindep 2.1.0. While the previous name is still supported, it will
be deprecated.

Move the file around to follow this change.

Note that this change is self-testing, the OpenStack CI infrastructure
will use a "bindep.txt" file to setup nodes for testing.

For more information about bindep, see also:
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/bindep/

As well as this announcement:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101590.html

Change-Id: I7862a3d3fd962e5658ff15cab3aeb005b0a32bfa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/api-site refs/changes/13/354913/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: #########################Default Variables ================= .. literalinclude:: ../../defaults/main.yml :language: yaml :start-after: under the License. Required Variables ================== This list is not exhaustive at present. See role internals for further details. .. code-block:: yaml horizon_ssl_protocol: "ALL -SSLv2 -SSLv3" horizon_ssl_cipher_suite: "ECDH+AESGCM:DH+AESGCM:ECDH+AES256:DH+AES256:ECDH+AES128:DH+AES:ECDH+3DES:DH+3DES:RSA+AESGCM:RSA+AES:RSA+3DES:!aNULL:!MD5:!DSS" horizon_galera_address: 10.100.100.101 horizon_container_mysql_password: "SuperSecrete" horizon_secret_key: "SuperSecreteHorizonKey" Example Playbook ================ .. code-block:: yaml - name: Installation and setup of horizon hosts: horizon_all user: root roles: - { role: "os_horizon", tags: [ "os-horizon" ] } vars: galera_client_drop_config_file: false external_lb_vip_address: 10.100.100.101 internal_lb_vip_address: 10.100.100.101 horizon_galera_address: 10.100.100.101 horizon_container_mysql_password: "SuperSecrete" horizon_secret_key: "SuperSecreteHorizonKey" horizon_external_ssl: true horizon_ssl_protocol: "ALL -SSLv2 -SSLv3" horizon_ssl_cipher_suite: "ECDH+AESGCM:DH+AESGCM:ECDH+AES256:DH+AES256:ECDH+AES128:DH+AES:ECDH+3DES:DH+3DES:RSA+AESGCM:RSA+AES:RSA+3DES:!aNULL:!MD5:!DSS" galera_root_password: "secrete" rabbitmq_servers: 10.100.100.101 rabbitmq_use_ssl: false rabbitmq_port: 5671 keystone_admin_user_name: admin keystone_auth_admin_password: "SuperSecretePassword" keystone_admin_tenant_name: admin keystone_service_adminuri_insecure: false keystone_service_internaluri_insecure: false keystone_service_internaluri: "http://{{ internal_lb_vip_address }}:5000" keystone_service_internalurl: "{{ keystone_service_internaluri }}/v3" keystone_service_adminuri: "http://{{ internal_lb_vip_address }}:35357" keystone_service_adminurl: "{{ keystone_service_adminuri }}/v3" openrc_os_password: "{{ keystone_auth_admin_password }}" openrc_os_domain_name: "Default" memcached_servers: 10.100.100.101 memcached_encryption_key: "secrete" Tags ==== This role supports two tags: ``horizon-install`` and ``horizon-config`` The ``horizon-install`` tag can be used to install and upgrade. The ``horizon-config`` tag can be used to manage configuration.

commit_message:
[DOCS] Move ceilometer configs from developer docs

This commit moves the ceilometer configs in the developer docs
over to the role. It also cleans up README.rst and index.rst to
support the new tree structure for role docs.

As a note, some of the role docs(like this one), do a literalinclude
on files in the integrated repo. These references need to be fixed
to reference the link since the included file will no longer exist
in a guaranteed location that can be referenced with relative paths.

Change-Id: Icfaa49c1876b633adf6b61881006c676b1a57cdc
Signed-off-by: alextricity25 <miguel.cantu@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add vhost and users for roles depending on keystone

If a role depends of keystone, its testing generally needs to
have a fully working keystone. In this commit, we make sure
keystone properly has its rabbitmq vhost and users defined.

commit_message:
Account for the move of other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt

The default filename for documenting binary dependencies has been
changed from "other-requirements.txt" to "bindep.txt" with the release
of bindep 2.1.0. While the previous name is still supported, it will
be deprecated.

For more information about bindep, see also:
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/bindep/

As well as this announcement:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101590.html

Change-Id: Ibca1f6e053ca0b235d5b44e34cf7b0c7087d0801
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins refs/changes/51/355151/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if file_name.endswith('bindep.txt'): continue

commit_message:
Adjust TCP syncookes variable to bool

This patch changes the TCP syncookies variable to a boolean
rather than an integer to reduce confusion. It is still enabled
by default and the variable's name has changed:

  From: security_sysctl_tcp_syncookies
  To:   security_sysctl_enable_tcp_syncookies

Change-Id: I0120683963c968cf83d38e4df55f2094f74425fb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/29/351329/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: security_sysctl_enable_tcp_syncookies: yes # V-38539

commit_message:
Increase the quota in the OSIC cloud1

With the implementation and switch to IPv6 in OSIC cloud1 the
enviroment can now be used to support more instances. In this change
we're doubling the old quota and should everything function we'll
further increase the quota.

Change-Id: I947dc9ad139b36c5f9de05fbde54409e9198810a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
List instances for secgroup without joining on rules

Make db.security_group_get only join rules if specified in
the columns_to_join. This works around a performance issue
with lots of instances and security groups.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dansmith@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie3daed133419c41ed22646f9a790570ff47f0eec
Closes-Bug: #1552971

commit_message:
Use yaml.safe_load instead of yaml.load

This will resolve Bandit issue B506:yaml_load:

Use of unsafe yaml load. Allows instantiation of arbitrary objects. Consider yaml.safe_load()

Trivialfix

Change-Id: I1780c3cedff083984e0ef91817a904d9c66c795f

commit_message:
Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt

The default filename for documenting binary dependencies has been
changed from "other-requirements.txt" to "bindep.txt" with the release
of bindep 2.1.0. While the previous name is still supported, it will
be deprecated.

Move the file around to follow this change.

Note that this change is self-testing, the OpenStack CI infrastructure
will use a "bindep.txt" file to setup nodes for testing.

For more information about bindep, see also:
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/bindep/

As well as this announcement:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101590.html

Change-Id: I384cdb39c1f65218bb5c6f76afc381c1799b623e

subject: cephfs_native: enhance update_access()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-05 16:52:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/92bf38c76ce5f8ea784802c7cba5e98613d1deb0', 'message': "cephfs_native: enhance update_access()

CephFSVolumeClient, the interface to Ceph backend, did not
have the ability to fetch the existing access rules from the
backend. So during the recovery/maintenance mode, the driver
applied all the rules it was expected to sync, but couldn't
remove the undesired access rules from the backend as it couldn't
get the list of existing access rules.

Since the following commits in Ceph,

              SHA-1                      | Branch
--------------------------------------------------
1c1d65a45f4574ca5f33cc9d949089a5c956e363 | master
e1eb8afea9f202947eef33e8361a0aac0e955eea | Jewel

the CephFSVolumeClient can list the existing access rules. Use
this ability to fully implement update_access().

Also, when authorizing access for a ceph auth ID using
CephFSVolumeClient's authorize(), pass the project ID of the
share as an additional argument. This is required (since
the above mentioned commits) to retrieve the access key of
the ceph auth ID.

Partially Implements: bp cephfs-native-driver-enhancements
Change-Id: I49782d62c0a8382d985b9b08612cf5bc394837ae

rules it was expected to sync. It couldn't e.g., remove the
already existing but unwanted access rules from the backend.
This was because CephFSVolumeClient, the interface to Ceph
backend, did not have the ability to fetch the existing
access rules from the backend.

Since the following commits in Ceph,
              SHA-1                      | Branch
--------------------------------------------------
1c1d65a45f4574ca5f33cc9d949089a5c956e363 | master
e1eb8afea9f202947eef33e8361a0aac0e955eea | Jewel
the CephFSVolumeClient can list the existing access rules.
Use this to more faithfully implement update_access().

Also, when authorizing access for a ceph auth ID using
CephFSVolumeClient's authorize(), pass the project ID of the
share as an additional argument. This is required (since
the above mentioned commits) to retrieve the access key of
the ceph auth ID.

The driver's update_access() now returns access_keys as a
dictionary with access rule ID and access key as key, value
pairs. This would be useful once Manila can store the

Partially Implements: bp cephfs-native-driver-enhancements

commit_message:
cephfs_native: enhance update_access()

During recovery/maintenance mode, the driver applied all the
rules it was expected to sync. It couldn't e.g., remove the
already existing but unwanted access rules from the backend.
This was because CephFSVolumeClient, the interface to Ceph
backend, did not have the ability to fetch the existing
access rules from the backend.

Since the following commits in Ceph,
master branch, https://github.com/ceph/ceph/commits/1c1d65a45f4574
Jewel branch,  https://github.com/ceph/ceph/commits/e1eb8afea9f202
the CephFSVolumeClient is versioned and can list the existing
access rules. Use this to more faithfully implement update_access()
and ensure backwards compatibility with earlier versions of
CephFSVolumeClient.

Also, when authorizing access for a ceph auth ID using
CephFSVolumeClient's authorize(), pass the project ID of the
share as an additional argument. This is required (since
the above mentioned commits) to retrieve the access key of
the ceph auth ID.

The driver's update_access() now returns access_keys as a
dictionary with access rule ID and access key as key, value
pairs. This would be useful once Manila can store the
access_keys in its DB and expose them to the user.

Partially Implements: bp cephfs-native-driver-enhancements
Change-Id: I49782d62c0a8382d985b9b08612cf5bc394837ae
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/43/351843/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._share_path(share), ceph_auth_id, readonly=readonly, tenant_id=share['project_id']) access_keys = {} if not (add_rules or delete_rules): # recovery/maintenance mode add_rules = access_rules existing_auth_ids = set( id[0] for id in self.volume_client.get_authorized_ids(self._share_path(share)) ) want_auth_ids = set([rule['access_to'] for rule in add_rules]) delete_auth_ids = existing_auth_ids.difference(want_auth_ids) delete_rules = [] for delete_auth_id in delete_auth_ids: delete_rules = delete_rules.append( { 'access_to': delete_auth_id, 'access_type': CEPHX_ACCESS_TYPE, }) if add_rules: for rule in add_rules: access_key = self._allow_access(context, share, rule) access_keys.update({rule['id']: access_key}) if delete_rules: for rule in delete_rules: self._deny_access(context, share, rule) return access_keys
deleted_lines: self._share_path(share), ceph_auth_id, readonly=readonly) # The interface to Ceph just provides add/remove methods, since it # was created at start of mitaka cycle when there was no requirement # to be able to list access rules or set them en masse. Therefore # we implement update_access as best we can. In future ceph's # interface should be extended to enable a full implementation # of update_access. for rule in add_rules: self._allow_access(context, share, rule) for rule in delete_rules: self._deny_access(context, share, rule) # This is where we would list all permitted clients and remove # those that are not in `access_rules` if the ceph interface # enabled it. if not (add_rules or delete_rules): for rule in access_rules: self._allow_access(context, share, rule)

commit_message:
os-vif: do not set Route.interface if None

The Route.interface field in os-vif is currently
non-nullable, which means it must be something other
than None if set.

There is no code in nova that sets the interface field
on the nova.network.model.Route object, so it defaults
to None and is always set to None on the os-vif Route
object, which fails with:

"ValueError: Fieldinterface' cannot be None"

We don't hit this in the gate because we don't test with
subnets that have host_routes set.

commit_message:
NetApp cDOT driver configurable clone split

Define a NetApp extra spec that is used to define a share type
that selects whether an initial clone split will be processed
as part of the create-from-snapshot workflow.

Change-Id: I7370f8342b8a5a10861e6e8080555959b0c88d62
Implements: blueprint netapp-cdot-clone-split-control
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/61/353061/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - NetApp cDOT driver now supports a scoped extra-spec ``netapp:split_clone_on_create`` to be used in share types when creating shares (NetApp FlexClone) from snapshots. If this extra-spec is not included, or set to ``false``, the cDOT driver will perform the clone-split only if/when the parent snapshot is being deleted.

commit_message:
Fallback to the old /lookup endpoint on 401

Prior to this patch the ironic-python-agent service would only fallback
to use the old endpoints for /lookup and /heartbeat on a 404 error but,
since Ironic will check auth (if enabled) before it routes the requests
a 401 (Unauthorized) was returned.

Closes-Bug: #1612696
Change-Id: Idba5fed587e77aaa683d2c2b2126a520214712ce

commit_message:
Add cell_v2 verify_instance command

This adds a verify_instance command to nova-manage, which simply fetches
out the instance and cell mapping for a given instance uuid and prints
the result. This is useful to sanity-check a deployment after an upgrade,
and will be used by grenade to ensure that the mappings were created
after running the migration command.

Change-Id: I4aaff99d59e8b5f530a30f5aea0be195b246d9f7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/61/354261/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @args('--instance', metavar='<uuid>', dest='instance', help='The instance UUID to verify') def verify_instance(self, instance=None): if not instance: print('Must specify --instance') return 1 ctxt = context.RequestContext() try: mapping = objects.InstanceMapping.get_by_instance_uuid( ctxt, instance) except exception.InstanceMappingNotFound: print('Instance %s is not mapped to a cell' % instance) return 1 print('Instance %s is in cell: %s (%s)' % ( instance, mapping.cell_mapping.name, mapping.cell_mapping.uuid)) return 0

commit_message:
Make simple_cell_setup idempotent

This makes it so we can run the simple_cell_setup command multiple
times without failure. This would be important for things like grenade,
as well as deployment tools that need to just run it and might not
know if they're upgrading or deploying a new setup.

This rearranges the order in the simple_cell_setup command to do the
cell0 mapping first, to avoid running the host mapping other than the
very first time. Before, if the user was willing to tolerate the error,
they could run this command over and over and continue to map hosts
into cells. Since this change is encouraging the ability to run this
implicitly in multiple places, we want to defeat that behavor so that
it's not abused.

Change-Id: I559f9c87e89926414b368cac9442dec4eadcb89b

commit_message:
Allow authorization by user_id for server evacuate

Current policy enforcement does not allow authorization by user_id.
But there are some destructive actions which needs to be
isolated at user level also.

This patch allow authorization by user_id for server evacuate
Cloud provider can override default policy rule for evacuate with
"user_id:%(user_id)s" and user level isolation will be enabled.

Adding tests for user_id and project_id policy rule enforcement.

Partially implements blueprint user_id_based_policy_enforcement

Change-Id: I9b9614e71f87df18aaf5c2a7f17c367d61f22be7

commit_message:
Allow authorization by user_id for server update

Current policy enforcement does not allow authorization by user_id.
But there are some destructive actions which needs to be
isolated at user level also.

This patch allow authorization by user_id for server update.
Cloud provider can override default policy rule for update with
"user_id:%(user_id)s" and user level isolation will be enabled.

Adding tests for user_id and project_id policy rule enforcement.

Note- existing tests is updated to pass the project_id and user_id in
stub instance. Tried the minimum changes to pass the policy.

Partially implements blueprint user_id_based_policy_enforcement

Change-Id: I4b4d3f68ade8b3a3f180f1dbd2e2cfe04f6aec08

commit_message:
Allow authorization by user_id for server delete

Current policy enforcement does not allow authorization by user_id.
But there are some destructive actions which needs to be
isolated at user level also.

This patch allow authorization by user_id for server delete
Cloud provider can override default policy rule for server delete
action with "user_id:%(user_id)s" and user level isolation will be enabled.

Adding tests for user_id and project_id policy rule enforcement

Partially implements blueprint user_id_based_policy_enforcement

Change-Id: Ied8fd2d9cbd835290bc02808401a41f537a179f9

subject: Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-12 19:15:12.000000000', 'files': ['bindep.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sahara-dashboard/commit/1a19b8851c7d7d2daa2e22db4894ecd47eb9498d', 'message': 'Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt

The default filename for documenting binary dependencies has been
changed from "other-requirements.txt" to "bindep.txt" with the release
of bindep 2.1.0. While the previous name is still supported, it will
be deprecated.

Move the file around to follow this change.

Note that this change is self-testing, the OpenStack CI infrastructure
will use a "bindep.txt" file to setup nodes for testing.

For more information about bindep, see also:
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/bindep/

As well as this announcement:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101590.html

Change-Id: I2e8cdde59ceee844b1ef87f8844c1712ebc41cd1
'}]
commit_message:
Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt

The default filename for documenting binary dependencies has been
changed from "other-requirements.txt" to "bindep.txt" with the release
of bindep 2.1.0. While the previous name is still supported, it will
be deprecated.

Move the file around to follow this change.

Note that this change is self-testing, the OpenStack CI infrastructure
will use a "bindep.txt" file to setup nodes for testing.

For more information about bindep, see also:
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/bindep/

As well as this announcement:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101590.html

Change-Id: I2e8cdde59ceee844b1ef87f8844c1712ebc41cd1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-dashboard refs/changes/22/355022/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Allow authorization by user_id for server changePassword action

Current policy enforcement does not allow authorization by user_id.
But there are some destructive actions which needs to be
isolated at user level also.

This patch allow authorization by user_id for server changePassword action
Cloud provider can override default policy rule for server changePassword
action with "user_id:%(user_id)s" and user level isolation will be enabled.

Adding tests for user_id and project_id policy rule enforcement

Partially implements blueprint user_id_based_policy_enforcement

subject: CI: Add CI_WIKI_NAME to all drivers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-27 19:07:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/65cfd8390059eccfd6151e817a71bf00def5969c', 'message': 'CI: Add CI_NAME to all drivers

This patch adds a CI_NAME to each driver object.  The value is the exact
name of the ThirdPartySystems wiki page.   This allows us to create an
automated tool to associated jobs to drivers and track their CI reporting

commit_message:
CI: Add CI_WIKI_NAME to all drivers

This patch adds a CI_WIKI_NAME to each driver object.  The value is the exact
name of the ThirdPartySystems wiki page.   This allows us to create an
automated tool to associated jobs to drivers and track their CI reporting
status correctly.

This patch also updates the generate_driver_list.py script to output the
driver list as a python list of dicts that can be directly consumed.

Change-Id: I0ec5f705e91f680a731648cf50738ea219565f70
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/02/348002/14 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import argparseimport sysparser = argparse.ArgumentParser(prog="generate_driver_list") parser.add_argument("--format", default='str', choices=['str', 'dict'], help="Output format type") def output_str(): print('VOLUME DRIVERS') print('==============') print_drivers(util.get_volume_drivers(), 'volume_driver') print('BACKUP DRIVERS') print('==============') print_drivers(util.get_backup_drivers(), 'backup_driver') print('FC ZONE MANAGER DRIVERS') print('=======================') print_drivers(util.get_fczm_drivers(), 'zone_driver') def collect_driver_info(driver): """Build the dictionary that describes this driver.""" info = {'name': driver.class_name, 'version': driver.version, 'fqn': driver.class_fqn, 'description': driver.desc, 'ci_name': driver.ci_name} return info def output_dict(): import pprint driver_list = [] drivers = util.get_volume_drivers() for driver in drivers: driver_list.append(collect_driver_info(driver)) pprint.pprint(driver_list) args = parser.parse_args() if args.format == 'str': output_str() elif args.format == 'dict': output_dict()
deleted_lines: print('VOLUME DRIVERS') print('==============') print_drivers(util.get_volume_drivers(), 'volume_driver') print('BACKUP DRIVERS') print('==============') print_drivers(util.get_backup_drivers(), 'backup_driver') print('FC ZONE MANAGER DRIVERS') print('=======================') print_drivers(util.get_fczm_drivers(), 'zone_driver')

commit_message:
3PAR add entry point debug tracing

This patch adds the cinder.utils.trace decorator to the 3PAR
driver entry points.

Change-Id: I5173f97f867fad1dc079bcdeb26d8ead6839bcb4

commit_message:
Mask out passwords when tracing

This patch ensures that input and return parameters that are being
traced mask out passwords to the log file.

Change-Id: I71baa6ee7b2a474701a1caed99d4889fffc62eca

commit_message:
NetApp cDOT multi-SVM driver configurable NFS versions

A customer has requested the ability to selectively enable NFS versions
3, 4, and 4.1 in the cDOT multi-SVM drivers. This can be accomplished
via a config option.

Change-Id: Ia16a3bde81568096c118d61e808614d630616d0d
Implements: blueprint netapp-cdot-configure-nfs-versions

commit_message:
POC: This is the POC to support rolling upgrade without status

Basically, it's only 3 additional repo (expand, migrate and contract)
and the keystone-manage commands to call them.

There will be two repositories for contract, the script can be called
in this release cycle and the script only can be called in a future
release which is not sure so far. The script should be moved manually
when there is no code access the DB schema that will be migrated. And
the script should have a release name in as the part of the name, so
it will be clear when the script is expected to be called.

TODO:
- Need testcases.

Change-Id: I1f33a7f3099dea670fed30d97609fc0aa1d484e6

commit_message:
Indicate to plugin resource verification where we are

This makes the resource verify commands take a second argument that
indicates if we are pre-upgrade or post-upgrade. This may be needed
in order to validate things that will not be true before, but must
be true after an upgrade.

Change-Id: I6383c5f641bb8eb7fee6f1fbd41bca3a281d9636

commit_message:
objects: introduce a util function to handle tenant_id filter

Objects will directly support project_id filters only. The tenant_id
property is provided for mere convenience, and does not serve for
filtering purposes. So every time we'll need to pass filters from API
that still supports tenant_id attribute filtering, we'll need to do the
filter conversion.

This patch introduces the util function that will later be used by
other objects, like subnet, security group, or subnetpool (for the
latter, once we convert its existing tenant_id field to project_id).

Change-Id: If82c180688e1ecdff1c8a6e29cb8668838ac0a5b
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

commit_message:
Pass timeout in milliseconds to timer_wait

The OVS Python library expects milliseconds to be passed to
timer_wait and we were passing the value in seconds. This
just means that the poll() wakes up more often than it needs
to. Changing this probably improves performance a little, but
doesn't change any user observable behavior.

Change-Id: Iae4b682c0774e749eb48cde67cd9748d7dfe053c
(cherry picked from commit 47fd1bc31560e47e5b4648e879a8cf92dfceeb4e)

commit_message:
Avoid breaking transaction when checking duplicates

This code make another query after catching DBDuplicateEntry.
It doesn't work [1] if we have a surrounding transaction,
as it's the case for some out-of-tree plugins including
networking-midonet.

This is a regression introduced by a recent commit. [2]

Note: Some plugin (eg. midonet) use l3_db and others (eg. odl)
use l3_dvr_db.

[1] sqlalchemy.exc.InvalidRequestError: This Session's transaction has been rolled back by a nested rollback() call. To begin a new transaction, issue Session.rollback() first.

[2] I15be35689ec59ac02ed34abe5862fa4580c8587c

Closes-Bug: #1611596
Change-Id: I70afcea717b7ca8434be0746a7809b94929b6803
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/45/353245/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Exclude delete_port from transaction_guard check

This reverts part of I9924600c57648f7eccaa5abb6979419d9547a2ff

There are out-of-tree service plugins which use this
method within a transaction.  eg. midonet l3 plugin's
remove_router_interface and delete_floatingip.

Closes-Bug: #1611533
Change-Id: I3f05d3ce402669160d56417c977cbf28d366c4c2

commit_message:
Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt

The default filename for documenting binary dependencies has been
changed from "other-requirements.txt" to "bindep.txt" with the release
of bindep 2.1.0. While the previous name is still supported, it will
be deprecated.

Move the file around to follow this change.

Note that this change is self-testing, the OpenStack CI infrastructure
will use a "bindep.txt" file to setup nodes for testing.

For more information about bindep, see also:
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/bindep/

As well as this announcement:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101590.html

Change-Id: If3bed66e2609531d14aa2e5d74c222b72fe7ef61

commit_message:
Allow authorization by user_id for server shelve action

Current policy enforcement does not allow authorization by user_id.
But there are some destructive actions which needs to be
isolated at user level also.

This patch allow authorization by user_id for server shelve action
Cloud provider can override default policy rule for server shelve action
with "user_id:%(user_id)s" and user level isolation will be enabled.

Adding tests for user_id and project_id policy rule enforcement

NOTE- moving all policy tests to policy test class

Partially implements blueprint user_id_based_policy_enforcement

Change-Id: I915b4de6141c2bbbedad7807dd02a2d62fed8f06

subject: DVR: Clean stale snat-ns by checking its existence when agent restarts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-05 21:09:54.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/namespace_manager.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/agent.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_edge_ha_router.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_router_base.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_namespace_manager.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_edge_router.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/namespaces.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/6e5892da1434a1a7674456aa4c897480fbb0208b', 'message': 'DVR: Clean stale snat-ns by checking its existence when agent restarts

At present there is no clear way to distinguish when the snat_namespace
object is initialized and when the actual namespace is created.
There is no way to check if the namespace already existed. The
code was only checking at the snat_namespace object instead of its
existence.

This patch addresses the issue by adding in an exists method to the
namespace object to identify the existence of the namespace in the
given agent.

This would allow us to check for the existence of the namespace,
and also allow us to identify the stale snat namespace and
delete the namespace when the gateway is cleared as the agent restarts.

This also applies for conditions when the router is manually moved
from one agent to another agent while the agent is dead. When the
agent wakes up it would clean up the stale snat namespace.
Change-Id: Icb00297208813436c2a9e9a003275462293ad643
Closes-Bug: #1557909
(cherry picked from commit acd04d668bd414cd21f2715adc6a35a0eaed59a3)
'}]
commit_message:
DVR: Clean stale snat-ns by checking its existence when agent restarts

At present there is no clear way to distinguish when the snat_namespace
object is initialized and when the actual namespace is created.
There is no way to check if the namespace already existed. The
code was only checking at the snat_namespace object instead of its
existence.

This patch addresses the issue by adding in an exists method to the
namespace object to identify the existence of the namespace in the
given agent.

This would allow us to check for the existence of the namespace,
and also allow us to identify the stale snat namespace and
delete the namespace when the gateway is cleared as the agent restarts.

This also applies for conditions when the router is manually moved
from one agent to another agent while the agent is dead. When the
agent wakes up it would clean up the stale snat namespace.
Change-Id: Icb00297208813436c2a9e9a003275462293ad643
Closes-Bug: #1557909
(cherry picked from commit acd04d668bd414cd21f2715adc6a35a0eaed59a3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/23/351923/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def exists(self): return self.ip_wrapper_root.netns.exists(self.name)

commit_message:
Add setting default max_burst value if not given by user

If user will not provide burst value for bandwidth limit rule there is
need to set such value on appropriate to ensure that bandwith limit
will work fine.
To ensure at least proper limitation of TCP traffic we decided to set
burst as 80% of bw_limit value.
LinuxBridge agent already sets is like that. This patch add same
behaviour for QoS extension driver in openvswitch L2 agent.

DocImpact: Add setting default max_burst value in LB and OvS drivers

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/linux/tc_lib.py

Change-Id: Ib12a7cbf88cdffd10c8f6f8442582bf7377ca27d
Closes-Bug: #1572670
(cherry picked from commit f766fc71bedc58a0cff0c6dc6e5576f0ab5e2507)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/17/347017/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(slaweq): Value used to calculate burst value for egress bandwidth limit # if burst is not given by user. In such case burst value will be calculated # as 80% of bw_limit to ensure that at least limits for TCP traffic will work # fine. DEFAULT_BURST_RATE = 0.8

commit_message:
Add tests for user_id policy enforcement on trigger_crash_dump

Server crash dump trigger action enforce the policy with user_id
and project_id, this patch adds unit tests to verify the same.

Also pass the specific user_id and project_id explicitly in target
for policy enforcement instead of complete instance object.

Partially implements blueprint user_id_based_policy_enforcement

Change-Id: I86ba3db3dc40210f3e373194e18775085845d435
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/10/354510/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: context.can(server_policies.SERVERS % 'trigger_crash_dump', target={'user_id': instance.user_id, 'project_id': instance.project_id})

commit_message:
Allow authorization by user_id for force_delete server

Current policy enforcement does not allow authorization by user_id.
But there are some destructive actions which needs to be
isolated at user level also.

This patch allow authorization by user_id for force_delete server
Cloud provider can override default policy rule for force_delete server
with "user_id:%(user_id)s" and user level isolation will be enabled.

Partially implements blueprint user_id_based_policy_enforcement

Change-Id: I927e1b350309a698b83ad9d40311197b304c3222

commit_message:
Maintain backwards compat for listen opts

Technically you can use a hostname, that then gets resolved by DNS to
find the IP address to bind to. Although this is not actually a very
good idea, because it just picks the first IP it gets and tried to bind
to that one, which is not always the best idea.

Related-Bug: #1611940

blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

Change-Id: Icd271b62935969036b6622b8582edec8bd496dd2

commit_message:
Add missing namevar method to openstack_config provider

openstack_config contains a method 'self.instances' that is required for
purging unmanaged resources that references a static namevar method that
is not defined in openstack_config and may not be provided by base
classes. The 'namevar' method doesn't require any information from the
derived class so a default implementation in the base provider type
suffices.

Closes-Bug: #1612009

Change-Id: If27152863b9df5a28bf45e23ca989019666a958c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstacklib refs/changes/96/354096/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def self.namevar(section_name, setting) "#{section_name}/#{setting}" end

commit_message:
Remove code duplication in enums

Each Cinder's Enum field declaration has almost the same __init__
method. To avoid duplication this patch moves __init__ method with
required logic to the base class.

Change-Id: I566aef9241af570762bcc64eadc6adb3e8e10991
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/77/353977/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

 backend2_name = BACKEND2
That was changed to accomodate >2 backends. tempest.conf now uses a comma

devstack/lib/cinder uses a comma separated list with "type:backend_name":

'}]
commit_message:
Add a multibackend list to tempest.conf

A change was made to tempest.conf for volume multibackend. Previously,
tempest used the following, with a limit of 2 backends:
 backend1_name = BACKEND1
 backend2_name = BACKEND2
That was changed to accomodate >2 backends. tempest.conf now uses a comma
separated list:
 backend_names=BACKEND1,BACKEND2,BACKEND3

devstack/lib/cinder uses a comma separated list with "type:backend_name":
 enabled_backends = lvm:BACKEND1,ceph:BACKEND2
This is in order to use scripts in devstack/lib/cinder_backends to setup
devstack basked on "type".

This patch allows parsing of the CINDER_ENABLED_BACKENDS to pass the proper
backend_name to tempest.

Change-Id: I76973c3fad4998a0f9e534fc9f6a271c1923f7b3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/95/325895/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: add_comma_seperator=0 backends_list='' # create a backend list, backend_names = BACKEND_1,BACKEND_2 if [ "$add_comma_seperator" -eq "1" ]; then backends_list+=,${be##*:} else # first element in the list backends_list+=${be##*:} add_comma_seperator=1 fi iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG volume "backend_names" "$backends_list"
deleted_lines: local i=1 local be local be_name=${be##*:} iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG volume "backend${i}_name" "$be_name" i=$(( i + 1 ))

commit_message:
Use neutron-lib add_validator for registration

As per [1], neutron-lib 0.3.0 provides a public add/get API for
local validator registration/access. This API is preferred over
directly accessing the validators dict module-level attribute
that's done today when adding a new validator and in fact
direct access to the validators dict is deprecated.

This patch changes all neutron's usage of the validators dict
to use the public API.

Closes-Bug: #1584237

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/324090/

Change-Id: I97680b0a8d88cb753199fce7949cfb24b506a0ff

commit_message:
Add tests for user_id policy enforcement on stop

Server stop enforce the policy with user_id, This patch adds unit
tests to verify the same. Some duplicate tests are removed in the
effort.

Also pass the specific target for policy enforcement instead of
complete instance object.

Adding tests for user_id and project_id policy rule enforcement

Note- deleting test_stop_policy_failed from test_serversV21.py as this
is duplicate of what we have in test_server_start_stop.py

Partially implements blueprint user_id_based_policy_enforcement

Change-Id: I064ccef55612c2609dbf8617817c00207dde0a1b

commit_message:
Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt

The default filename for documenting binary dependencies has been
changed from "other-requirements.txt" to "bindep.txt" with the release
of bindep 2.1.0. While the previous name is still supported, it will
be deprecated.

Move the file around to follow this change.

Note that this change is self-testing, the OpenStack CI infrastructure
will use a "bindep.txt" file to setup nodes for testing.

For more information about bindep, see also:
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/bindep/

As well as this announcement:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101590.html

Change-Id: I3be36dd6402e4da8976c1163635c1e40b7eb5ba9

commit_message:
Allow authorization by user_id for server pause action

Current policy enforcement does not allow authorization by user_id.
But there are some destructive actions which needs to be
isolated at user level also.

This patch allow authorization by user_id for server pause action.
Cloud provider can override default policy rule for pause action with
"user_id:%(user_id)s" and user level isolation will be enabled.

Partially implements blueprint user_id_based_policy_enforcement

Change-Id: I2cd59e3ba25efacb8d663aa86ed744167e78d2b3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/21/352221/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova import policy ctxt.can(ps_policies.POLICY_ROOT % 'pause', target=policy.prepare_target_from_resource(server))

commit_message:
Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt

The default filename for documenting binary dependencies has been
changed from "other-requirements.txt" to "bindep.txt" with the release
of bindep 2.1.0. While the previous name is still supported, it will
be deprecated.

Move the file around to follow this change.

Note that this change is self-testing, the OpenStack CI infrastructure
will use a "bindep.txt" file to setup nodes for testing.

For more information about bindep, see also:
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/bindep/

As well as this announcement:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101590.html

Change-Id: Ibffad3665fea9be1ee6404b3f99ee0f23feb50e5

subject: Concurrency issue in K2 iSCSI and FC Cinder drivers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-02 17:54:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/28055b14237e4d27fbbbedfa4f32e6f866868b7a', 'message': 'Concurrency issue in K2 iSCSI and FC Cinder drivers

Cinder tempest tests are failed with concurrency>1 due to
possible race conditions between attach and detach volumes and

operations.

Kaminario K2 iSCSI and FC arrays do not support concurrent operations.
To avoid this, use locks and retry mechanism on each K2 requests.
Also, use locks to avoid race conditions between attach and
detach volumes.

Closes-Bug: #1608913

commit_message:
Concurrency issue in K2 iSCSI and FC Cinder drivers

Kaminario K2 iSCSI and FC arrays do not support concurrent operations.
To avoid this, use locks and retry mechanism on each K2 requests.
Also, use locks to avoid race conditions between attach and
detach volumes.
Change-Id: Ia5c37ebf0333f962ee1a71f71337e6b9c133241b
Closes-Bug: #1608913
Co-Authored-By: Lakshmi Narayana<Lakshmi.Narayana.ctr@kaminario.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sreedhar Varma<Sreedhar.Varma.ctr@kaminario.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ido Benda<Ido.Benda@kaminario.com>

commit_message:
Add ability to change apt/yum package state for the haproxy_server role

The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

Change-Id: I3732efabfa4fc7e80a8f172abd1415fd54489763

commit_message:
Install required packages for get_url module

To prevent Ansible get_url module from generating SNI warnings
several system packages are being installed so that system python
will allow us to get pip and install it.

The strategy for using system pip to install the python packages
to prevent SNI warnings causes additional issues as system package
pip versions may be broken in spectacular ways which prevent us from
upgrading to pinned versions of each of pip, setuptools, wheel.

Change-Id: I45e3eff716dba4fb2926794bc25bfb079bb328bf
Closes-Bug: 1612377

commit_message:
iscsi initiator names must be unique among hosts

Initiator names are generated during image build and therefore are
not unique in multi-host environment. Instead the names should be
autogenerated during first start of iscsid containers.

Change-Id: Ia439b1563c9c9d6c26d8a314fe2817ba493dacb5
Closes-Bug: 1611775

added_lines: #!/bin/bash # check if unique iSCSI initiator name already exists if [[ ! -f /etc/iscsi/initiatorname.iscsi ]]; then echo "Generating new iSCSI initiator name" echo InitiatorName=$(/sbin/iscsi-iname) > /etc/iscsi/initiatorname.iscsi fi

commit_message:
Enable neutron gw charm to control # of workers

Charm was missing this functionality and this patch is to add
this feature. We were trying to deploy this charm on bare metal
host machine with 72 cores. In end up creating 144 processes for
nova-metadata-api, and neutron.

This patch will provide the option to limit the number of worker
process in case of high number of cores in a host.

Enable it for icehouse, kilo, liberty and mitaka.

cherry picked from commit 93d6440e459f19676ce9336332e4f91efc85897f

Partial-Bug: 1600482
Change-Id: Iedcbe6c53746a203937b78dd00e83fda7681bd8f

commit_message:
Update the home-page info with the developer documentation

Since there are so many components in openstack,
by describing the URL info in the configuration file,
it is more convenient to find the developer documentation
than from the unified portal

Change-Id: Iedb4ed50b2db722b6d1e1e6c412371317aa2db54

commit_message:
Add uplink provider network to neutron network

At midonet we are using a custom provider network
type since edge router is also inside our managed
topology

Change-Id: I22ca765c2e83218d82c9826e8dae753ddfa365dc
(cherry picked from commit 9ecb912d24541aeedc35fd9f553c9f64c20373d4)

added_lines: # == Class: mistral::cors # # Configure the mistral cors # # === Parameters # # [*allowed_origin*] # (Optional) Indicate whether this resource may be shared with the domain # received in the requests "origin" header. # (string value) # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*allow_credentials*] # (Optional) Indicate that the actual request can include user credentials. # (boolean value) # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*expose_headers*] # (Optional) Indicate which headers are safe to expose to the API. # (list value) # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*max_age*] # (Optional) Maximum cache age of CORS preflight requests. # (integer value) # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*allow_methods*] # (Optional) Indicate which methods can be used during the actual request. # (list value) # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*allow_headers*] # (Optional) Indicate which header field names may be used during the actual # request. # (list value) # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # class mistral::cors ( $allowed_origin = $::os_service_default, $allow_credentials = $::os_service_default, $expose_headers = $::os_service_default, $max_age = $::os_service_default, $allow_methods = $::os_service_default, $allow_headers = $::os_service_default, ) { oslo::cors { 'mistral_config': allowed_origin => $allowed_origin, allow_credentials => $allow_credentials, expose_headers => $expose_headers, max_age => $max_age, allow_methods => $allow_methods, allow_headers => $allow_headers, } }

commit_message:
Refactor version negotiation middleware

This patch refactors the version_negotiation middleware in preparation
for switching micro-version negotiation to v1 endpoint.

Change-Id: I99859acdd7fa435ddfd64461d20875d2d1c9d61f

commit_message:
cephfs_native: add read-only share support

Add read-only share support for cephfs_native driver
using CephFSVolumeClient's enhanced authorize() interface.
Ensure backwards compatibility with older version of
CephFSVolumeClient by checking it's version attribute, or
lack thereof.

The support for read-only authorize() was added in
CephFSVolumeClient with the following commits in Ceph:

Master branch:
https://github.com/ceph/ceph/commit/011ea5e7fb35ee0

Jewel branch:
https://github.com/ceph/ceph/commit/2cd3ed8a59786be

Change-Id: I29eb45104c04da1706c3978441babe9c4a52ca02
DocImpact
Partially-Implements: bp cephfs-native-driver-enhancements

subject: Prevent doc generation failure on OVO decorators
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-28 17:22:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/953dee546980d95574b5aa27a335214447124ef5', 'message': "Prevent doc generation failure on OVO decorators

Currently Sphinx will fail to generate the documentation if we are using
decorators from any OVO in cinder.objects, because the OVOs are only
added to the cinder.objects namespace when the CLI programs are run.

So we need to run `register_all` method during documentation generation
to avoid failures like:

    AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'Volume'

This patch modifies autogenerated doc/source/conf.py file and since now
it is no longer completely autogenerated it is added to PEP8 checks,
which required some minor changes.

Change-Id: Ifeeef61a778f9e3f3daceba8ed05cd2036219499

commit_message:
Prevent doc generation failure on OVO decorators

Currently Sphinx will fail to generate the documentation if we are using
decorators from any OVO in cinder.objects, because the OVOs are only
added to the cinder.objects namespace when the CLI programs are run.

So we need to run `register_all` method during documentation generation
to avoid failures like:

    AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'Volume'

This patch modifies autogenerated doc/source/conf.py file and since now
it is no longer completely autogenerated it is added to PEP8 checks,
which required some minor changes.

Change-Id: Ifeeef61a778f9e3f3daceba8ed05cd2036219499

commit_message:
Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt

The default filename for documenting binary dependencies has been
changed from "other-requirements.txt" to "bindep.txt" with the release
of bindep 2.1.0. While the previous name is still supported, it will
be deprecated.

Move the file around to follow this change.

Note that this change is self-testing, the OpenStack CI infrastructure
will use a "bindep.txt" file to setup nodes for testing.

For more information about bindep, see also:
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/bindep/

As well as this announcement:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101590.html

Change-Id: I000a4e708006263acc6d9731a6677a6e62e285b6

commit_message:
network: fix handling of linux-bridge in os-vif conversion

The nova.network.model.Network class uses names
'should_create_{bridge,vlan}' not 'should_provide_{bridge,vlan}'

The bridge_interface attribute should always be set, even if
to None, since None is a valid value.

The vlan attribute is compulsory if should_create_vlan is
set.

Closes-bug: 1612281
Change-Id: I245f560156d596be14ef9181bfb881be9680c166

commit_message:
Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt

The default filename for documenting binary dependencies has been
changed from "other-requirements.txt" to "bindep.txt" with the release
of bindep 2.1.0. While the previous name is still supported, it will
be deprecated.

Move the file around to follow this change.

Note that this change is self-testing, the OpenStack CI infrastructure
will use a "bindep.txt" file to setup nodes for testing.

For more information about bindep, see also:
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/bindep/

As well as this announcement:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101590.html

Change-Id: I7a7c355439c3d3e3099ef5c8d8e1f2063397de28

commit_message:
Enable the Ubuntu binary build and deploy for all branch in kolla

Now, the ubuntu has Newton packaging[1]. So we can enable the binary
build and deploy on the master branch.

[1]
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-June/097173.html

Depends-On: I5832a729a9a4fa73c02442047c92ba088ce20db3

commit_message:
Deal with clouds that don't have fips betterer

In the code that supplements the nova provided floating IP dict by
checking neutron, we actually don't properly account for the case where
the cloud just flat doesn't have floating ips.

Change-Id: I18ee39e8450e868a842771f2febf4daac606fee5

subject: Remove "Services which consume this" section
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-12 18:58:42.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/_drivers/swift/store.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance_store/commit/5ff6709e0aeb03b0ecfe1793f711f04d2416f351', 'message': 'Remove "Services which consume this" section

In the first few improvements to the help text of configuration
options, the section "Services which consume this" was included
to clearly indicate which services consume a particular
configuration option. However, this is redundant information as
all glance services have their configuration files. And, the very
fact that a configuration option appears in a certain file
indicates that the corresponding service potentially consumes it.

Change-Id: I1dbaf620d5d9e7025a491b28546be66bfa4442c3
Partial-Bug: #1570946
'}]
commit_message:
Remove "Services which consume this" section

In the first few improvements to the help text of configuration
options, the section "Services which consume this" was included
to clearly indicate which services consume a particular
configuration option. However, this is redundant information as
all glance services have their configuration files. And, the very
fact that a configuration option appears in a certain file
indicates that the corresponding service potentially consumes it.

Change-Id: I1dbaf620d5d9e7025a491b28546be66bfa4442c3
Partial-Bug: #1570946

commit_message:
Enable CRUD for Subnet Service Types

This patch enables basic CRUD operations to support
Subnet service-types.

Partially-implements: blueprint service-subnets

Co-Authored-By: John Davidge <john.davidge@rackspace.com>

Change-Id: I0a1724ad00f0a3e675bb700cdd291f55f898c6f3

commit_message:
Perform str_replace trying to match longest string first

Purpose is to avoid str_replace from doing partial replace
when a shorter instance of a matching key is found.

Change-Id: I63c13f4eb3b1375cb2df1a34fd4f09561564f400
Co-Authored-By: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: 1600209

commit_message:
Doc: Recommend users to update their systems

Updates documentation to remind users to update their systems when
running devstack. An issue in Fedora 23 causes devstack to fail. This
is resolved by updating the system.

Change-Id: Ibdad67d00061e4d9b4e4469efcec415f7573ee04
Closes-Bug: 1605681
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/36/354136/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. note:: On Fedora 23 this setup will fail unless your system has the latest packages installed. Run the following command to do this:: sudo dnf upgrade

commit_message:
Race-free synchronize policies

It seems reasonable to expect that a policy is added right away
on the local PE after datasource creation.

Poor user experience if can't add rule until next periodic synch.

I added explicit call to synch policies on local PE, if present.
If we decide we can also broadcast to all PEs to synch.

lock added to avoid concurrency errors in synchronize_policies

Change-Id: I48bb98854c8bc0e8a137093fd98fc49b7731b31d

commit_message:
Add tox/requirements settings to pass gate job

Plus, we need liberasurecode version handling for a few place because
some tests/engine itself is broken with a lack of backword
compatibility.

Closes-Bug: #1586220

Change-Id: I72adaefa10875a73e3e5304eb40fe5d9f6d2598a

commit_message:
Don't try to get stack details if the stack doesn't exist

If a run fails before the overcloud is deployed or we are running
get_host_info.sh after deleting the overcloud then all of the
commands that operate on the stack will fail.  Let's not even run
those if we don't find the stack.

Change-Id: I06ff879424793ea1372889ae2c0e0740c45cb5c8

subject: Add a unique key to port_id in routerports table
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-26 01:51:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/9f5b5cdbc0d43b7a571239073c6187a79fcdf4c4', 'message': "This patch avoids duplicate port records in routerport table

If multiple commands to assign the same port as multiple routers'
interfaces, multiple port records would exists in routerport
database, eventhough only the lastest arrived request would be
kept in port table resulting as the router's interface. The patch
adds a composite unique key between port_id and port_type, so that
requests arrive later than the first one, would be avoided from
entering routerports table

Change-Id: I15be35689ec59ac02ed34abe5862fa4580c8587c
Closes-Bug: #1535551

"}, {'number': 11, 'created': '2016-06-21 05:34:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/0dba027981807c37b23738e5aa6c8b66c9f832af', 'message': 'Add a unique key to port_id in routerports table

If multiple commands to add router interfaces to different routers
by the same port concurrently. All the commands would show success.
However, there are three issues:
1. Only one router interface is actually added by the port
2. Multiple router ports records are stored in routerports table
3. The port table is updated multiple times and eventually the
last-arrived command would trully take effect

This patch adds a unique key to port_id, so that only the first-
arrived command will insert router port record and all the latter
requests would raise exceptions. Besides, the patch updates port
table after router port record is inserted to keep consistency.

Change-Id: I15be35689ec59ac02ed34abe5862fa4580c8587c
Closes-Bug: #1535551

information from last-arrived request. However, in routerport table,
only the first-arrived request's router information is inserted.

Closes-Bug: #1535551

commit_message:
Add a unique key to port_id in routerports table

If multiple commands to add router interfaces to different routers
by the same port are executed concurrently, then all the commands
would show success.

However, there are three issues:
1. Only one router interface is actually added by the port
2. Multiple router ports records are stored in routerports table
3. The port table is updated multiple times and eventually the
last-arrived command would truly take effect

This patch adds a unique key to port_id in routerport table,
so that only the first-arrived command will insert router port
record and all later requests would raise exceptions.

Besides, port.device_id and port.device_owner in port table
needs to be updated again after routerport record is inserted.
Otherwise, in race condition the port table will store the router
information from last-arrived request. However, in routerport table,
only the first-arrived request's router information is inserted.

Change-Id: I15be35689ec59ac02ed34abe5862fa4580c8587c
Closes-Bug: #1535551
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/48/285048/20 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: __table_args__ = ( sa.UniqueConstraint( port_id, port_type, name='uniq_routerports0port_id0port_type'), model_base.BASEV2.__table_args__,)

subject: Make revision bump robust to concurrent removals
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-10 07:19:59.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/revisions/revision_plugin.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/revisions/test_revision_plugin.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/9e8bcf45a53718da588e70785c77dd7215e12017', 'message': 'Make revision bump robust to concurrent removals

If there expired objects in the session that are concurrently
deleted by another sesssion, the revision code will get an
ObjectDeletedError when it goes to check if the expired object
is a related object to the object it is handling. So we need
to catch this error an continue on since there is nothing it
needs to do.

Change-Id: Ie6034f36c34099f2646840cbdd569a4398534df5
Closes-Bug: #1611627
'}]
commit_message:
Make revision bump robust to concurrent removals

If there expired objects in the session that are concurrently
deleted by another sesssion, the revision code will get an
ObjectDeletedError when it goes to check if the expired object
is a related object to the object it is handling. So we need
to catch this error an continue on since there is nothing it
needs to do.

Change-Id: Ie6034f36c34099f2646840cbdd569a4398534df5
Closes-Bug: #1611627

commit_message:
Allow authorization by user_id for server rescue action

Current policy enforcement does not allow authorization by user_id.
But there are some destructive actions which needs to be
isolated at user level also.

This patch allow authorization by user_id for server rescue action
Cloud provider can override default policy rule for rescue with
"user_id:%(user_id)s" and user level isolation will be enabled.

Partially implements blueprint user_id_based_policy_enforcement

Change-Id: I98bf9e2769791da75bd264dc8f2313adb8b75ec1

commit_message:
[DOCS] Remove apt proxy when rebuilding AIO

Update documentation to include removing the apt proxy configuration
file. Leaving this file in place after the repo-server has been removed
will lead any apt commands failing with a 503 error.

Change-Id: Iad2a9b8b2a138627eeca63ab715a8c3c14f4ac7b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/70/355070/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Remove the apt package manager proxy # rm /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/00apt-cacher-proxy

commit_message:
Enable neutron gw charm to control # of workers

Charm was missing this functionality and this patch is to add
this feature. We were trying to deploy this charm on bare metal
host machine with 72 cores. In end up creating 144 processes for
nova-metadata-api, and neutron.

This patch will provide the option to limit the number of worker
process in case of high number of cores in a host.

Enable it for icehouse, kilo, liberty and mitaka.

Partial-Bug: 1600482
Change-Id: Iedcbe6c53746a203937b78dd00e83fda7681bd8f
